1.text: Thou shalt not envy against men of evil, thou shalt not desire to be with them.

2.text: For their heart will meditate destruction, and their lips will speak labor.

3.text: By wisdom a house will be built, and it will be prepared by understanding:

4.text: And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.

5.text: A wise man is in strength, and a man of knowledge strengthens power.

6.text: For by guidance thou shalt make to thee war, and in the multitude of counselors salvation.

7.text: High things to the foolish is wisdom: in the gate he will not open his mouth.

8.text: He purposing to do evil for himself shall be called the master of mischief.

9.text: The purpose of folly is sin, and he mocking, an abomination to man.

10.text: Wilt thou be discouraged in the day of straits thy strength is narrow.

11.text: If thou shalt refrain to deliver those being brought to death, and those going to be slain;

12.text: If thou shalt say, Behold, we knew not this; will not he trying hearts, understand? and he guarding thy soul, knew? and he turned back to man according to his work.

13.text: My son, eat honey, for it is good; and the dropping of honey being sweet to thy palate.

14.text: So the knowledge of wisdom to thy soul if thou shalt find: and there is a latter state and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

15.text: Thou shalt not lay wait, O wicked one, against the dwelling of the just one; thou shalt not destroy his resting place:

16.text: For the just one shall fall seven times, and rise: and the unjust shall be weak in evil.

17.text: In the falling of thine enemies thou shalt not rejoice, and in his stumbling thy heart shall not exult:

18.text: Lest Jehovah shall see and it be evil in his eyes, and he turn back from him his anger.

19.text: Thou shalt not be angry against the evil; thou shalt not envy against the unjust:

20.text: For there shall be no latter state to the evil one: the light of the unjust shall be extinguished.

21.text: My son, fear thou Jehovah and the king: thou shalt not intermingle with those changing:

22.text: For suddenly shall their calamity rise, and who shall make known the misfortune of them two?

23.text: Also these to the wise. To look upon the face in judgment is not good.

24.text: He saying to the unjust, Thou art just; peoples shall curse him, and nations shall curse him:

25.text: And it shall be pleasant to those reproving, and a blessing of good shall come upon them.

26.text: He shall kiss the lips turning back right words.

27.text: Prepare thy work without, and make it ready for thee in the field afterwards; and build thy house.

28.text: Thou shalt not be a witness gratuitously against thy neighbor, and deceive not with thy lips.

29.text: Thou shalt not say, According to what he did to me, thus will I do to him: I will turn back to the man according to his work.

30.text: I passed upon the field of the slothful man, and upon the vineyard of the man wanting heart;

31.text: And behold, it came up all of it with thorns; brambles covered its face, and the wall of its stones was overthrown.

32.text: And I shall see and set my heart: I looked, I took instruction.

33.text: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to lie down:

34.text: And thy poverty came going about, and thy want as a man of shield.
